_prev_prog_2.Description:
We require that our chlorine supplier provide properly tested tanks with well-maintained valves. We use

vacuum chlorinators, therefore, if a hole develops in a process line, air will be drawn in instead of chlorine

leaking out. We provide chlorine training and require that two people be present when handling chlorine. We

have chlorine leak repair kits and personal Self-contained Breathing Apparatus (SCBA) provided to trained employees so we can repair leaks. Leak detectors, which give both local and remote alarms, are used at the plant. If a leak occurs, an alarm sounds at our

dispatch center,which is staffed 24 hours a day, 365 days a year, and members of our chlorine response team

respond. There are two members of the chlorine response team on call at all times. The detectors also

activate a scrubber which is designed to vacuum up the chlorine-contaminated air, neutralize the chlorine

and discharge relatively clean air to the environment. Finally, we have our Risk Management Program

documentation, which includes our written standard operating procedures for our chlorine process, chlorine

handling, and safety procedures.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Jonesboro City Water and Light

East Side Wastewater Treatment Plant

RISK MANAGEMENT PROGRAM

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY





1.0    Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies



The Jonesboro City Water and Light (CWL) East Side Wastewater Treatment Plant is committed to the safety of our workers, the public, and the environment.  The resources invested in the prevention of accidental releases of hazardous substances demonstrate this commitment.  The CWL East Side Wastewater Treatment Plant implements reasonable controls, such as training of personnel and the safe design, installation, operation and maintenance of our processes.  Our policy is to make every effort to prevent the release of hazardous substances but in the event of a release, our trained personnel and local emergency response agencies will respond to control and contain the release in a manner that will be safe for workers and will help prevent injuries to the public or the environment.





2.0    Description of the CWL East Side Wastewater Treatment Plant and Regulated Substances



The CWL East Side Wastewater Treatment Plant handles one substance regulated by the Risk Management Plan Rule (RMP Rule) in quantities above the Threshold Quantity.  This substance is:



* Chlorine - stored in 1 ton cylinders and used for disinfection of the water prior to release to the receiving stream.







3.0    Hazard Assessment

 

The RMP Rule requires the CWL East Side Wastewater Treatment Plant to perform a Hazard Assessment of the regulated substances stored and used in the covered processes at the facility.  This Hazard Assessment includes an offsite consequence analysis for the following scenarios:

 

* One worst-case and one alternative release scenario for the toxic substance chlorine for the chlorination process unit at the facility.



The CWL East Side Wastewater Treatment Plant completed a Hazard Assessment for the covered processes and the results have been appropriately communicated to the loc

al emergency response agencies. The Hazard Assessment has been recently updated to reflect changes in population.





4.0    Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps



The RMP Rule requires that a prevention program be established for the CWL East Side Wastewater Treatment Plant chlorination processes.  The following details the prevention program elements at The CWL East Side Wastewater Treatment Plant that apply to these processes.



4.1    Safety Information



The CWL East Side Wastewater Treatment Plant maintains a variety of technical documents that are used to help ensure safe operation of the CWL East Side Wastewater Treatment Plant processes.  Safety data sheets (SDSs) document the physical and chemical properties of hazardous substances handled at the CWL East Side Wastewater Treatment Plant, including the chlorine in the covered process.  The engineering design documents include the operating parameters, the design basis and configuration of the equipment in each covered process, and references to applicable codes and standards.





4.2    Hazard Review



The CWL East Side Wastewater Treatment Plant performs and periodically updates hazard reviews of the covered processes to help identify and control process hazards.  Checklists are used to guide the hazard review.  These checklists include items to help ensure the CWL East Side Wastewater Treatment Plant operates and maintains the equipment in a manner consistent with the applicable design specifications, codes, standards, and regulations.



4.3    Operating Procedures



The CWL East Side Wastewater Treatment Plant develops and maintains operating procedures to define how tasks related to process operations should be performed.  The operating procedures are used to:



1. train employees, and

2. serve as reference guides for appropriate actions to take during both normal and abnormal process conditions.



4.4    Training



The CWL East Side Wastewater Treatment Plant trains

personnel in the operating procedures to help ensure safe and effective performance of their assigned tasks. A record of all training is maintained to help ensure new and refresher training is provided on a timely basis.



4.5    Maintenance



The CWL East Side Wastewater Treatment Plant properly maintains the equipment in our processes.  The CWL East Side Wastewater Treatment Plant maintenance program includes:



1. procedures to safely guide workers in their maintenance tasks,

2. worker training in the maintenance procedures, and

3. inspection and testing program to help identify equipment deterioration and damage before equipment fails.



4.6    Compliance Audits



The CWL East Side Wastewater Treatment Plant performs periodic (at least every three years) audits of covered processes to verify the processes are operating in compliance with the requirements of the RMP Rule.  A compliance audit report is prepared after each audit, and any deficiencies noted by the audit are corrected in a timely manner.





4.7    Incident Investigations



The CWL East Side Wastewater Treatment Plant investigates all incidents that could reasonably have resulted in a serious injury to personnel, the public, or the environment.  The CWL East Side Wastewater Treatment Plant trains employees to identify and report any and all incidents requiring investigation.  An investigation team is assembled and the investigation is initiated within 48 hours of the incident.  The results of the investigation are documented, recommendations are resolved, and appropriate process enhancements are implemented.



4.8    Chemical-specific Prevention Steps - Chlorine



Industry standards are followed at the CWL East Side Wastewater Treatment Plant to help ensure safe handling of chlorine.  The vendor supplies chlorine via a Department of Transportation (DOT) approved truck and in DOT approved 1 ton cylinders.  The process equipment is designed and constructed with state-of-the-art materials and technology

utilizing the standards and guidelines of the Chlorine Institute, American Water Works Association, ASME, ANSI, and other applicable codes.  Workers who perform operations involving chlorine receive training emphasizing safe handling procedures according to the guidelines required by the CWL East Side Wastewater Treatment Plant.





5.0    Five Year Accident History



There have been no accidents or incidents that resulted in injuries to employee, the public, or the environment at the CWL East Side Wastewater Treatment Plant in the past five years.





6.0    Emergency Response Programs



The CWL East Side Wastewater Treatment Plant has prepared a written emergency response action plan that complies with the RMP Rule, other federal standards and industry guidelines.  This plan has been communicated to the Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) and local fire department.





7.0    Planned Changes to Improve Safety



The CWL East Side Wastewater Treatment Plant continuously attempts to improve the safety of our processes to protect our employees, the public and the environment.  The CWL East Side Wastewater Treatment Plant incident investigations, employee suggestions and improvements in technology are utilized to update the safety aspects of the processes.  The following changes to improve process safety are planned or have recently been completed.



1. All delivery drivers are certified to be trained on the safe handling of chlorine,

2. Cylinder hoists are inspected monthly by qualified maintenance personnel and are certified annually according to manufacturer recommendations.

3. The chlorine feed equipment is changed out every six months as a preventive maintenance measure.
